alert.note: Alert for Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 14 at 3:33AM MST until February 15 at 6:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 6 AM MST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 3000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 3000 feet. Rain and snow showers this afternoon will transition to all snow by late afternoon. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Areas above 3000 feet near Camp Verde, Chino Valley, Congress, Cottonwood, Paulden and Prescott Valley. * WHEN...From 2 PM this afternoon to 6 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Strong and gusty winds will cause periods of very poor visibility in blowing snow. The hazardous conditions will impact the Tuesday evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. Snow forecast from 2 PM Today to 6 AM Wednesday: Camp Verde 0 to 1 inches Chino Valley 1 to 2 inches Congress 0 to 1 inches Cottonwood 0 to 1 inches Paulden 0 to 1 inches Prescott Valley 1 to 3 inches .
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
